page.title: 10The 1984 Pit Strike
page.content: Being in the North Nottinghamshire Area of the N.C.B.,Welbeck Colliery was not fully closed down by the 1984 -1985 Miners Strike.Initially about 1/3 of the workforce joined the strike but unrest about the right to hold a national ballot and about the likely length of strike action because of existing coal stocks led to Notts pits such as Welbeck opting out of the strike action .About 1/15 of the men continued the strike and this led to bitterness within the community and at the pit gate where local and "flying" pickets gathered. Extra police from all over the country were billeted on the Welbeck Estate .Unknown cars were stopped for questioning at strategic junctions on routes to pits such as the Cuckney crossroads.Once violence occurred in the streets of Cuckney but this was exaggerated by the media.
